result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd C Walberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 12 days Huber for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd C Walberts in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #2.Count #2 is dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Weitzner makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

FINE:  $1009.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50/month, commencing on 08/01/16, alternate is 12 days Huber).

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Todd C Walberts did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Todd C Walberts in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Todd C Walberts did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Todd C Walberts did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Next date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd C Walberts in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is trying to obtain counsel.  Defendant to go directly to the public defenders office today after court.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. No contact with codefendant named in Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Todd C Walberts not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case recalled at 10:40 a.m.
Defendant, Todd C. Walbers in court (arrived late). District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashed warrant.   
Court advises of right to an attorney.
Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
